stepAnswer: The absolute difference between the number of heads observed and 5: $$T=∣H-5∣$$
stepBody: What is a good test statistic that you could compute from the outcome of his flips? Calculate that statistic for your observed data; this is our observed test statistic.
answerLatex: The absolute difference between the number of heads observed and 5: $$T=∣H-5∣$$
choices: The difference between the number of heads observed and 5: $$T=H-5$$
The absolute difference between the number of heads observed and 5: $$T=∣H-5∣$$
The square of the number of heads observed: $$T=H^2$$
